    • Method Detail

      • write

        public long write(long offset,
                  byte value)
        Description copied from interface: Output
        Writes a single byte to the given offset and the underlying sink. If the offset is outside the writable area a NoSuchByteException is thrown. Otherwise the byte is written and the new offset is returned.
        Specified by:
        write in interface Output
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset to write to
        value - the value to write
        Returns:
        the new offset after writing

      • write

        public long write(byte[] bytes,
                  long offset,
                  int length)
        Description copied from interface: Output
        Writes zero or more bytes defined by the given length. Data is written from the given byte-array (bytes) and writing starts from the provided offset. If offset or offset plus length results in an offset larger than the writable area, or length is larger then the given byte-array's length, a NoSuchByteException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        write in interface Output
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to write
        offset - the offset to write to
        length - the number of bytes to write
        Returns:
        the new offset after writing

      • read

        public byte read(long offset)
          throws NoSuchByteException
        Description copied from interface: Input
        Reads a single byte at the given offset from the underlying stream. If the offset is outside the readable area a NoSuchByteException is thrown. Otherwise the byte is returned.
        Specified by:
        read in interface Input
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset to read from
        Returns:
        the byte at the given offset
        Throws:
        NoSuchByteException - if offset is outside the readable area

      • offsetValid

        public boolean offsetValid(long offset)
        Description copied from interface: Input
        Returns true if the given offset is inside the readable area, otherwise false.
        Specified by:
        offsetValid in interface Input
        Parameters:
        offset - offset to validate
        Returns:
        true if offset is valid, otherwise false

      • read

        public long read(byte[] bytes,
                 long offset,
                 int length)
        Description copied from interface: Input
        Reads zero or more bytes defined by the given length. Data is read into the given byte-array (bytes) and reading starts at the provided offset. If offset or offset plus length results in an offset larger than the readable area, or length is larger then the given byte-array's length, a NoSuchByteException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        read in interface Input
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to read to
        offset - the offset to start reading
        length - the number of bytes to read
        Returns:
        returns the number of byte read
